blocks.title: Waterfalls + easy cloud forest trails
blocks.summary: Short hikes, viewpoints, and lush jungle scenery — a perfect intro day that still feels like Ecuador.
blocks.notes: Pack a light rain layer and grippy shoes. Trails can be muddy.

blocks.title: Hot springs + light canyon walks
blocks.summary: Relaxation meets adventure — warm pools, easy trails, and optional add-ons if you want more.
blocks.notes: Bring a swimsuit and a small towel. Best after activity or late afternoon.

blocks.title: First surf lesson + beach adventure day
blocks.summary: A fun, beginner-friendly way to add energy to your itinerary without needing advanced skills.
blocks.notes: Most operators provide safety gear. Ask about pickup time and what to wear.

blocks.title: Cotopaxi day hike (refugio + viewpoints)
blocks.summary: One of the best “big day” adventures — high-altitude landscapes without committing to a summit climb.
blocks.notes: Bring layers and sun protection. Altitude can feel intense even on easy routes.

blocks.title: Rafting day (class depends on river)
blocks.summary: A classic Ecuador adventure — rivers range from fun + splashy to serious, depending on the route.
blocks.notes: Most operators provide safety gear. Ask about pickup time and what to wear.

blocks.title: Canopy zipline + cloud forest combo
blocks.summary: A high-energy day with iconic scenery — zipline circuits paired with trails, waterfalls, and viewpoints.
blocks.notes: Pack a light rain layer and grippy shoes. Trails can be muddy. Most operators provide safety gear. Ask about pickup time and what to wear.

blocks.title: High-altitude ridgelines + long volcanic routes
blocks.summary: Longer hikes at altitude where weather and pacing matter — the Andes is the playground here.
blocks.notes: Bring layers and sun protection. Altitude can feel intense even on easy routes.

blocks.title: Serious canyoning routes
blocks.summary: Bigger rappels, faster water, and higher intensity lines — best done with experienced guides.
blocks.notes: Most operators provide safety gear. Ask about pickup time and what to wear.

blocks.title: Remote jungle days (long boat + trekking)
blocks.summary: Multi-hour river travel, humid trails, and longer days — rewarding, but physically demanding.
blocks.notes: Pack a light rain layer and grippy shoes. Trails can be muddy. Plan for flexible timing and keep the next day light if travel is involved.

blocks.title: Cotopaxi summit climb
blocks.summary: A true mountaineering objective — altitude, glacier conditions, and a serious achievement.
blocks.notes: Bring layers and sun protection. Altitude can feel intense even on easy routes.

blocks.title: Galapagos dive trips (iconic marine life)
blocks.summary: World-class diving with big wildlife moments — plan around conditions and permitted sites.
blocks.notes: Most operators provide safety gear. Ask about pickup time and what to wear. Plan for flexible timing and keep the next day light if travel is involved.

blocks.title: High-intensity rafting or extreme canyoning day
blocks.summary: If you want adrenaline on water — choose routes that match your skills and conditions.
blocks.notes: Most operators provide safety gear. Ask about pickup time and what to wear.

blocks.title: Cloud forest waterfalls + gentle trails
blocks.summary: Easy hikes, lush greenery, and waterfall viewpoints — great for a relaxed nature-first day.
blocks.notes: Pack a light rain layer and grippy shoes. Trails can be muddy.

blocks.title: Highland lakes + panoramic viewpoints
blocks.summary: Clean air, open landscapes, and dramatic horizons — a simple itinerary win with low effort.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Beach nature day + coastal sunsets
blocks.summary: A slower coastal day: shoreline walks, ocean air, and easy nature time with zero pressure.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Cotopaxi landscapes + páramo trails
blocks.summary: Open highland terrain, volcanic scenery, and iconic Ecuador nature — perfect for active day hikes.
blocks.notes: Bring layers and sun protection. Altitude can feel intense even on easy routes. Pack a light rain layer and grippy shoes. Trails can be muddy.

blocks.title: Cloud forest viewpoints + canopy walks
blocks.summary: A full day of misty trails, waterfalls, and elevated views — classic nature with variety.
blocks.notes: Pack a light rain layer and grippy shoes. Trails can be muddy.

blocks.title: Hot springs route + river scenery
blocks.summary: Combine nature scenery with warm-water recovery — great for travelers who like to stay moving.
blocks.notes: Bring a swimsuit and a small towel. Best after activity or late afternoon.

blocks.title: Rainforest lodge base + guided jungle walks
blocks.summary: Wake up inside the ecosystem — guided trails, river edges, and nighttime sounds you won’t forget.
blocks.notes: Pack a light rain layer and grippy shoes. Trails can be muddy. Plan for flexible timing and keep the next day light if travel is involved.

blocks.title: River canoe time + forest edges
blocks.summary: Slow travel through river corridors for maximum nature immersion and photography opportunities.
blocks.notes: Plan for flexible timing and keep the next day light if travel is involved.

blocks.title: Cloud forest deep trails + hidden waterfalls
blocks.summary: Go beyond the quick stops — longer trails, fewer crowds, and more of the real forest rhythm.
blocks.notes: Pack a light rain layer and grippy shoes. Trails can be muddy.

blocks.title: Volcano viewpoints + big sky landscapes
blocks.summary: Classic Andean scenery where the scale is the experience — perfect for first-time Ecuador trips.
blocks.notes: Bring layers and sun protection. Altitude can feel intense even on easy routes.

blocks.title: Galapagos ecosystems + coastal trails
blocks.summary: Island nature that feels like nowhere else — plan around routes, time, and permitted sites.
blocks.notes: Plan for flexible timing and keep the next day light if travel is involved.

blocks.title: Highland lakes + dramatic ridgelines
blocks.summary: Wide-open viewpoints, clean air, and classic photo stops that define Ecuador’s highlands.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Hummingbird gardens + easy reserve walks
blocks.summary: Short trails, frequent sightings, and a great intro to Ecuador’s biodiversity without going remote.
blocks.notes: Most operators provide safety gear. Ask about pickup time and what to wear.

blocks.title: Guided nature walk for endemic species
blocks.summary: A guide helps you find what you’d miss on your own. Ideal for first-time wildlife travelers.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Coastal reserve day with wildlife surprises
blocks.summary: Combine beach time with nature. Mangroves, coastal forests, and frequent bird activity.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Cloud forest birding (target species mornings)
blocks.summary: Early starts, strategic reserve choices, and high species variety in a compact area.
blocks.notes: Pack a light rain layer and grippy shoes. Trails can be muddy.

blocks.title: Endemic-focused routes (Andes hotspots)
blocks.summary: Build your trip around endemics and elevation bands for maximum variety.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Photography-friendly birding stops
blocks.summary: Well-known feeders, good angles, and consistent sightings. Great for close-ups.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Rainforest lodge base + guided wildlife walks
blocks.summary: Maximize encounters with guided day walks, river edges, and nighttime listening sessions.
blocks.notes: Pack a light rain layer and grippy shoes. Trails can be muddy. Plan for flexible timing and keep the next day light if travel is involved.

blocks.title: Canopy and river systems (big biodiversity)
blocks.summary: Wildlife hotspots happen at ecosystem edges. River corridors and canopy zones are key.
blocks.notes: Most operators provide safety gear. Ask about pickup time and what to wear. Plan for flexible timing and keep the next day light if travel is involved.

blocks.title: Night walks + amphibians and insects
blocks.summary: Some of Ecuador’s most memorable wildlife appears after dark. Guides make it safe and rewarding.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Galapagos endemic wildlife (iconic encounters)
blocks.summary: The world’s most famous wildlife destination. Plan routes carefully for maximum variety.
blocks.notes: Plan for flexible timing and keep the next day light if travel is involved.

blocks.title: Coastal marine reserves + boat day
blocks.summary: A strong option if you want ocean wildlife without a full island itinerary.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Mangroves + coastal bird activity
blocks.summary: Great for birders who also want coastal ecosystems. Calmer water and consistent sightings.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Hot springs soak and spa reset
blocks.summary: Unwind with a simple wellness day centered around warm mineral water and a slow pace.
blocks.notes: Bring a swimsuit and a small towel. Best after activity or late afternoon.

blocks.title: Scenic lodge base with optional soak
blocks.summary: Stay somewhere quiet with views and add a short soak session when you want it.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Low-planning relaxation trip
blocks.summary: A calm itinerary with just one highlight a day. Sleep in, explore lightly, repeat.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Single base, short day trips
blocks.summary: A simple plan: one home base, easy outings, and plenty of downtime built in.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Nature-forward lodging
blocks.summary: Choose a stay that feels like the destination. Views, quiet mornings, and easy walks.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Relaxed culture and cafés
blocks.summary: Slow city days with markets, cafés, and a calm pace without constant transit.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Beach days, no schedule
blocks.summary: Keep it simple: ocean, long meals, and nothing timed unless you want it.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Coastal nature and sunsets
blocks.summary: Light exploration in the afternoon, then sunset downtime with zero rush.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Quiet seaside base
blocks.summary: A calm home base so you can alternate between rest and short local outings.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Walkable city + downtime
blocks.summary: A calm pace with easy walking, cafés, and gentle culture days.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Food, parks, and viewpoints
blocks.summary: Minimal transit, maximum comfort. Choose a few simple highlights and relax.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Short stay recharge
blocks.summary: Perfect for 2–3 nights when you want to reset before moving on.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Highland market morning + comfort lunch
blocks.summary: Browse stalls, try local snacks, then finish with a classic soup or hearty plate in a family-run spot.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Street food sampling (small bites only)
blocks.summary: A slow walk, a few tasting stops, and a relaxed pace. Perfect for first-timers.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Street food sampling (small bites only)
blocks.summary: A slow walk, a few tasting stops, and a relaxed pace. Perfect for first-timers.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Traditional meal + local bakery stop
blocks.summary: Pair one signature dish with something sweet. Keep the day light and food-forward.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Ceviche culture lunch (your first stop)
blocks.summary: Try one ceviche style, then add a second small plate if you’re hungry. Let freshness lead.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Seafood market + cooked-to-order plate
blocks.summary: Walk the market, then choose a simple cooked dish nearby. Great for photographers too.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Sunset dinner by the water
blocks.summary: A calm beach day, then a seafood dinner at golden hour. Minimal planning, maximum reward.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Cacao tasting (learn the basics fast)
blocks.summary: Try multiple percentages and styles, then keep your afternoon simple so it stays enjoyable.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Cacao tasting (learn the basics fast)
blocks.summary: Try multiple percentages and styles, then keep your afternoon simple so it stays enjoyable.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Cacao experience + scenic rest day
blocks.summary: Pair a cacao visit with a relaxing day so you don’t turn it into a rushed checklist.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Amazon flavor day (ingredients + story)
blocks.summary: A deeper cultural angle: native ingredients and traditional preparation with local context.
blocks.notes: Pack a light rain layer and grippy shoes. Trails can be muddy.

blocks.title: Café crawl (max 2 stops)
blocks.summary: Pick one anchor café, then one second stop. Don’t overdo it. Keep it calm and intentional.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Coffee tasting + local pastry pairing
blocks.summary: A simple tasting with a sweet bite. Great for friends and couples.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Coastal alternative (coffee + warm pace)
blocks.summary: If you want cafés with beach time, the Coast offers a slower, warmer rhythm.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Market morning + artisan browsing
blocks.summary: Start with a traditional market, then visit nearby artisan shops for textiles, ceramics, and small crafts.
blocks.notes: Most operators provide safety gear. Ask about pickup time and what to wear.

blocks.title: Hands-on workshop (short + local)
blocks.summary: A small craft lesson or demonstration that keeps the focus on people and process, not souvenirs.
blocks.notes: Most operators provide safety gear. Ask about pickup time and what to wear.

blocks.title: Food + culture stroll (simple loop)
blocks.summary: Pair one local dish with a short walk through historic streets and daily-life neighborhoods.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Food + culture stroll (simple loop)
blocks.summary: Pair one local dish with a short walk through historic streets and daily-life neighborhoods.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Colonial city walk (one district)
blocks.summary: Choose one historic area and explore slowly with stops for viewpoints, plazas, and architecture details.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Museum + café reset
blocks.summary: A simple culture day: one museum, then downtime. Works well on travel days.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Heritage town base + short excursions
blocks.summary: Stay in a scenic town and take short cultural outings without turning the day into a checklist.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Community visit + craft context
blocks.summary: Learn the story behind weaving, carving, or painting and how it connects to identity and daily life.
blocks.notes: Most operators provide safety gear. Ask about pickup time and what to wear.

blocks.title: Cultural exchange day (slow pace)
blocks.summary: A slower day focused on conversation, small demonstrations, and shared meals when available.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Amazon community life (when appropriate)
blocks.summary: A deeper cultural angle built around local knowledge, river life, and sustainable traditions.
blocks.notes: Pack a light rain layer and grippy shoes. Trails can be muddy.

blocks.title: Festival day plan (light + flexible)
blocks.summary: Arrive early, keep expectations open, and focus on one or two key moments rather than everything.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Festival day plan (light + flexible)
blocks.summary: Arrive early, keep expectations open, and focus on one or two key moments rather than everything.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Music, dance, and evening culture
blocks.summary: If timing aligns, build an evening around local music, small performances, and community energy.
blocks.notes: Start earlier if you want fewer crowds and the best light.

blocks.title: Traditions day (markets + rituals)
blocks.summary: A non-festival alternative that still feels cultural: markets, crafts, and local daily rhythms.
blocks.notes: Most operators provide safety gear. Ask about pickup time and what to wear.

blocks.title: Island hopping + snorkeling day
blocks.summary: A high-reward coastal day combining boat rides, swim stops, and easy exploration of small islands and bays.
blocks.notes: Best in calmer seas. Bring reef-safe sunscreen and a dry bag for your phone.

blocks.title: Mangrove kayak adventure
blocks.summary: Paddle through quiet mangrove channels to spot birds, crabs, and mangrove wildlife at a relaxed pace.
blocks.notes: Go with a guide for the best routes and wildlife spotting. Bug spray recommended.

blocks.title: Sunset paragliding flight over the coast
blocks.summary: A scenic adrenaline hit with wide ocean views and a gentle landing back near the beach.
blocks.notes: Weather dependent. Wear closed-toe shoes and a light jacket.

blocks.title: Mangrove birding walk + boardwalk lookout
blocks.summary: A calm birding-focused outing with chances for herons, egrets, kingfishers, and shorebirds.
blocks.notes: Early start improves sightings. Bring binoculars and water.

blocks.title: Whale watching and marine wildlife cruise
blocks.summary: A boat trip focused on marine wildlife with seasonal whale sightings plus seabirds and dolphins.
blocks.notes: Seasonal experience. Ask operators about best months and sea conditions.

blocks.title: Coastal estuary birding and photography session
blocks.summary: A flexible, low-impact birding block designed to fill gaps: wetlands, estuaries, and shoreline viewpoints.
blocks.notes: Ideal for a lighter day or between bigger activities. Pair with a café stop nearby.

blocks.title: River canoe + waterfall hike combo
blocks.summary: Mix water and trail time: a short canoe ride followed by a rainforest hike to a waterfall swim spot.
blocks.notes: Pack a towel and dry clothes. Footing can be muddy after rain.

blocks.title: Night jungle walk for nocturnal wildlife
blocks.summary: A guided evening walk to experience the Amazon after dark with a focus on sounds, insects, frogs, and night creatures.
blocks.notes: Bring a headlamp if you have one. Long sleeves recommended.

blocks.title: Canopy zipline adventure in the rainforest
blocks.summary: A fun canopy-level experience that adds variety to Amazon days without heavy hiking.
blocks.notes: Weight limits may apply. Wear closed-toe shoes.

blocks.title: Canopy birding at a tower or viewpoint
blocks.summary: Early birding from a canopy-level viewpoint with better visibility for toucans, tanagers, and mixed flocks.
blocks.notes: Best at sunrise. Bring binoculars and a rain cover for gear.

blocks.title: Quiet canoe wildlife spotting
blocks.summary: A low-noise canoe outing designed for wildlife sightings along river edges and forest corridors.
blocks.notes: Choose a calm section of river. Great paired with a relaxed afternoon.

blocks.title: Parrot and macaw clay lick birding morning
blocks.summary: A classic Amazon birding highlight where parrots and other birds gather, typically early in the day.
blocks.notes: Logistics vary by lodge and river access. Confirm departure time the night before.

blocks.title: Beach relaxation + coastal walk
blocks.summary: Unstructured beach time with swimming, shade breaks, and an easy coastal stroll.
blocks.notes: Bring sunscreen, water, and sandals. This day is intentionally flexible and can be shortened or extended.

blocks.title: Mangrove & estuary wildlife visit
blocks.summary: Birdlife, crabs, and estuary ecosystems with a local guide.
blocks.notes: Best done early morning for wildlife activity and cooler temperatures. Binoculars recommended.

blocks.title: Sunset beach walk
blocks.summary: Golden-hour coastal walk with relaxed pace and photography stops.
blocks.notes: Ideal after a full activity day. Photography-friendly and low physical effort.

blocks.title: Amazon river wildlife excursion
blocks.summary: Boat-based wildlife viewing with birds, monkeys, and river life.
blocks.notes: Wildlife sightings vary by season and river conditions. Life jackets are provided.

blocks.title: Canopy walk + jungle exploration
blocks.summary: Walk suspended bridges and forest trails with a local guide.
blocks.notes: Closed-toe shoes recommended. Can be humid; light rain is common.

blocks.title: Night wildlife walk
blocks.summary: Guided evening walk to spot frogs, insects, and nocturnal species.
blocks.notes: Flashlights are usually provided. Expect insects and uneven terrain.

blocks.title: Scenic viewpoints + easy walks
blocks.summary: Light exploration of scenic viewpoints without strenuous hiking.
blocks.notes: Suitable for acclimatization days. Can be combined with a café or lunch stop.

blocks.title: Morning market visit
blocks.summary: Colorful market walk with local food tastings and crafts.
blocks.notes: Arrive early for the best atmosphere and fewer crowds.

blocks.title: Coffee tasting stop
blocks.summary: Short coffee tasting highlighting Ecuadorian beans.
blocks.notes: Short experience that pairs well with walking or sightseeing.

blocks.title: Galapagos coastal walk
blocks.summary: Easy shoreline walk with marine wildlife sightings.
blocks.notes: Easy terrain with frequent stops. Wildlife sightings are common near shorelines.

blocks.title: Light snorkeling session
blocks.summary: Beginner-friendly snorkeling with calm conditions.
blocks.notes: Mask and snorkel usually included. Calm conditions required.

blocks.title: Island town sunset stroll
blocks.summary: Relaxed town walk with harbor views and local life.
blocks.notes: Great low-effort option after a water activity day.

blocks.title: Amazon community visit
blocks.summary: Learn about daily life, crafts, and traditions.
blocks.notes: Respect local customs and photography guidelines.

blocks.title: Free explore coastal town
blocks.summary: Unscheduled time to explore cafes, shops, and beaches.
blocks.notes: No fixed schedule. Ideal buffer day between activities.

blocks.title: Rest & recovery day
blocks.summary: Light recovery day with optional short walks.
blocks.notes: Designed to prevent burnout. Optional spa or thermal soak works well here.

blocks.title: Cuicocha Crater Lake Rim Hike
blocks.summary: A scenic hike along the rim of the Cuicocha volcanic crater, offering panoramic views of the emerald lake, volcanic islands, and surrounding Andean landscapes.
blocks.notes: Weather dependent

blocks.title: Cuicocha Crater Lake Boat Crossing
blocks.summary: Scenic boat ride across the emerald waters of Cuicocha, offering close-up views of volcanic islands and surrounding Andean landscapes.
blocks.notes: Weather dependent; often combined with crater rim hikes.

blocks.title: Cotacachi Leather Artisan Experience
blocks.summary: Explore Cotacachi’s renowned leather workshops and markets, meeting local artisans and learning about traditional craftsmanship.
blocks.notes: Free time for browsing and purchases included.

blocks.title: Zuleta Embroidery Workshop
blocks.summary: Hands-on embroidery session with Zuleta artisans, learning symbolic Andean patterns and traditional techniques.
blocks.notes: Supports local women-led cooperatives.

blocks.title: Zuleta Countryside Walks
blocks.summary: Leisurely walks through Zuleta’s rolling countryside, stone walls, and pastoral landscapes with Andean mountain views.
blocks.notes: Ideal for all ages; can be paired with a farm lunch.
